channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on April 28
item.description:
April 28, 2020 7:47 AM

Good morning! Here are our top stories to kick-start your Tuesday, April 28.

item.title: Coronavirus: Man charged over fake news on supermarket closures
item.description:
April 28, 2020 5:00 AM

A 40-year-old Singaporean man has been charged over false claims he allegedly made that supermarkets would open only two days a week as part of enhanced measures here.

item.title: Dogged determination helped her become Singapore's first guide dog mobility instructor
item.description:
April 28, 2020 5:00 AM

A book about working dogs, borrowed from her primary school library, ignited a passion in Ms Christina Teng to become a dog trainer.

item.title: 2 elderly S'porean men die; most of 799 new coronavirus cases are workers in dorms
item.description:
April 28, 2020 5:00 AM

Two more patients died from Covid-19 complications yesterday, bringing the total number of coronavirus-related deaths here to 14.

item.title: Coronavirus: Several motor workshops told to close within 48 hours
item.description:
April 28, 2020 5:00 AM

Barbers and bubble tea shops are not the only ones affected by enhanced measures to stem the coronavirus outbreak.

item.title: MPA: Most ships heed new emission curbs
item.description:
April 28, 2020 5:00 AM

The majority of ships that called at Singapore's port in the first quarter of this year complied with tighter sulphur emission regulations, the Maritime and Port Authority of Singapore (MPA) said yesterday.

item.title: More workers in essential services getting tested for Covid-19
item.description:
April 28, 2020 5:00 AM

They include front-line officers who have interacted with confirmed cases as the Government expands testing capabilities.

item.title: Coronavirus: Parliament could soon sit in two or more locations
item.description:
April 28, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore's Parliament could meet from multiple locations amid the coronavirus outbreak with a proposed change to the Constitution which seeks to allow MPs to be spread out in different places while it is in session.

item.title: Testing for Covid-19 also aids surveillance of high-risk groups
item.description:
April 28, 2020 5:00 AM

Testing for Covid-19 allows for surveillance of groups of people that are at higher risk of contracting or transmitting the disease.

item.title: Coronavirus: Volunteers team up to make masks at home, stitch by stitch
item.description:
April 28, 2020 5:00 AM

By day, Madam Choong Chui Ping teaches mechanical technology at the Institute of Technical Education. By night, the mother of two is a "tailor" who has been sewing masks - not for family or friends, but for strangers she may never meet.

item.title: Coronavirus: Minister addresses concerns over curbs on home-based bakers
item.description:
April 28, 2020 5:00 AM

The rules disallowing home-based bakers from operating during the coronavirus circuit breaker may be eased if community transmission numbers are brought down, said Minister for National Development Lawrence Wong.

item.title: Concern as workplace deaths hit 14 so far this year
item.description:
April 28, 2020 5:00 AM

A total of 14 workplace deaths were recorded in Singapore this year from Jan 1 to April 17, up from nine in the same period last year.

item.title: Coronavirus: Testing not a substitute for safe distancing, personal responsibility, says Minister Lawrence Wong
item.description:
April 28, 2020 5:00 AM

This is because there is a chance one might test negative for the virus but in fact be incubating it.

item.title: Coronavirus: Flood of claims stalls website for self-employed income relief
item.description:
April 28, 2020 5:00 AM

A flood of online submissions yesterday, the first day to submit applications for the Self-Employed Person Income Relief Scheme (Sirs), tripped up the website for most of the day.

item.title: Coronavirus: Plan for new sites to house recovered migrant workers
item.description:
April 28, 2020 5:00 AM

Some of the spaces will have short-to medium-term housing, but longer-term facilities are also on the cards.

item.title: Robots that disinfect surfaces with UV light to join Covid-19 fight
item.description:
April 28, 2020 5:00 AM

More than 200 locally made mobile robots that can disinfect surfaces using ultraviolet light will be rolled out in shopping malls and the healthcare and transport sectors by the end of the year to help fight the spread of Covid-19.

item.title: Coronavirus: 14 more test positive at Admiralty welfare home
item.description:
April 28, 2020 5:00 AM

Another 12 residents and two employees at a welfare home in Admiralty have tested positive for Covid-19, the Ministry of Health (MOH) and the Ministry of Social and Family Development (MSF) said yesterday.

item.title: Lawyers see surge in queries amid coronavirus pandemic
item.description:
April 28, 2020 5:00 AM

Singaporeans are flocking to law firms amid the coronavirus pandemic for advice on issues ranging from wrongful dismissal to visitation rights for divorced parents.

item.title: Coronavirus: Early intervention by several firms keeps their workers safe
item.description:
April 28, 2020 5:00 AM

While the number of infected workers has gone up in many dormitories, several companies have bucked the trend, having taken pre-emptive measures to keep their workers safe from the virus.

item.title: Two-week jail sentence for NUS student who molested woman on MRT
item.description:
April 28, 2020 5:00 AM

A 24-year-old university student given probation for molesting a woman during a train ride and at an MRT station had his probation sentence overturned, following a successful High Court appeal by the prosecution.

item.title: Coronavirus: Some workers riding out crisis in relative comfort, thanks to bosses
item.description:
April 28, 2020 5:00 AM

Bangladeshi Md Jowel Rana feared he would be next when three coronavirus cases were detected in the crowded dormitory he was living in, but his mood has taken on a far rosier glow, thanks to a surprise change in accommodation.

item.title: Older motorists get extension for licence renewal
item.description:
April 28, 2020 5:00 AM

Older drivers of cars, public buses and heavy vehicles with licences that are expiring this year will get a six-month extension to renew them.

item.title: Singapore has been ramping up testing for coronavirus to help curb spread
item.description:
April 28, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore has ramped up testing for the coronavirus in order to curb its spread and bring the outbreak under control.

item.title: 2 hospitals convert wards to care for coronavirus patients
item.description:
April 28, 2020 5:00 AM

When the severe acute respiratory syndrome (Sars) virus hit Singapore in 2003, Dr Hoi Shu Yin, then a front-line nurse at Tan Tock Seng Hospital (TTSH), saw the uncertainties and damage it caused.

item.title: Coronavirus: Fresh grads to get 4 education, training modules for free
item.description:
April 28, 2020 5:00 AM

From next month, 16,000 fresh graduates from the six autonomous universities can each take four continuing education and training (CET) modules offered by their alma maters for free.

item.title: Coronavirus numbers: Figuring out what to watch
item.description:
April 28, 2020 5:00 AM

Two days of falling infections raised hopes that were soon dashed.
